McMartinhttp://academic.research.microsoft.com/io.ashx?type=5&id=34593070&selfId1=-1&selfId2=-1&maxNumber=12&query=doctor Amsterdam
Angiotensin converting enzyme (ACE) inhibitors have proved to be effective antihypertensive agents in patients with essential hypertension, not only ,;vhen circulating renin is elevated, but also under normal or even low-renin conditions. The latter has aroused questions as to the mechanism of the hypotensive actio'n of ACE inhibitors. Some investigators have pointed to interference with vasoactive systems other ...
